other_tests.findings: Countless Sarcoptes scabei mites from both the scalp and nails, consistent with Norwegian scabies.
Five-nail avulsion with 50% urea cream under occlusion for 24 hours, followed by gentle curettage without anesthesia.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Nails showed rapid regrowth at follow-up 1 month later.

other_tests.procedure_name: Mineral oil preparation of distal plate nail clippings
other_tests.changes_over_time: Prompted additional nightly applications of permethrin 5% cream and a single dose of oral ivermectin to resolve residual infestation.

other_tests.findings: Atrophic epidermis, alternating areas of sclerosis and homogenization of the collagen, intense edema, and mild lymphocytic infiltrate in the dermis.
